channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-18383] Codecs with @DoNotPool annotation are not closed causing memory leak
item.description:
Compressors and Decompressions with a @DoNotPool annotation are not closed when they are returned to the CodecPool, which causes a native memory leak.

 

I have included a link to a Demo Project demonstrating the leak
item.summary: Codecs with @DoNotPool annotation are not closed causing memory leak

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
kevins-29 commented on code in PR #4585:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/4585#discussion_r938704526

##########
hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/io/compress/zlib/BuiltInGzipCompressor.java:
##########
@@ -102,7 +103,15 @@ public int compress(byte[] b, int off, int len) throws IOException {

if (state == BuiltInGzipDecompressor.GzipStateLabel.INFLATE_STREAM) {
// now compress it into b[]

  • int deflated = deflater.deflate(b, off, len);
    + int deflated;
    + try { + deflated = deflater.deflate(b, off, len); + }

    catch (NullPointerException npe) {

Review Comment:
Thank you, I wasn't too comfortable with this either.

kevins-29 opened a new pull request, #4739:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/4739

      1. Description of PR
        Explicitly call `end()` when returning `Decompressor` implementations with `DoNotPool` annotation to the `CodecPool`.
      1. How was this patch tested?
        I created the following [project](https://github.com/kevins-29/hadoop-gzip-memory-leak) to demo the leak. You can run the demo with

``` shell
./gradlew run --args=1024
```

and then monitor the memory usage using

```shell
while true; do echo \"$(date +%Y-%m-%d' '%H:%M:%S)\",$(pmap -x <PID> | grep "total kB" | awk '

{print $4}

'); sleep 10; done;
```

      1. Results - Before Patch

```
...
```

      1. Results - After Patch
        ```
        ...
        ```
